title: How to get imge base of current setting through script in IDA proï¼Ÿ
content:
As a beginner I'm trying to disassemble a file with IDA Pro 6.5. 
I know that the image base can be find in IDA Pro manu Edit -> Segment -> Rebase program.

Now, I want to get the image base of current setting through IDC or IDAPython. Are there anyone to tell me how to write script? 

Thanks in advance.

answers_data.content:
idaapi.get_imagebase() is your friend.

Just in case you didn't know, all the reference documentation for idapython is here

Example:

```
Python>hex(idaapi.get_imagebase())
0x100000L

```

comments.text: My firend, You mean that I should wirte a plug-in for get image base? but I just want to get image base through IDC or IDAPython?
No. Just run this function from the python command line near "Python" button or from "File-->Script command" dialog.
Yes, I got it. Thank you so much! My friend.
